content.description: Beautiful crack climbing up a long system of corners. Optional second pitch or rap from newly bolted anchors. Enjoy!
content.protection: Standard Trad Rack. 2 Bolt Chain Anchor.
content.location: Nice corner crack just right of Seats of Evil.

climbs.name: Spaceball
climbs.fa: Tyler Eglen, Clay Lippincott, David Jacobs, Ryan Myers

content.description: A shorter route leading up to a prominent ledge with rap ring anchors or the opportunity to link into upper pitches.
content.protection: Standard trad rack, Rap Ring Anchors
content.location: Between the base of Serious Enthusiasm tower and the base of Seats of Evil wall.

climbs.name: Serious Enthusiasm
climbs.fa: Ryan Myers, David Jacobs, Clay Lippincott, Tyler Eglen

content.description: A 35m pitch of sustained 5.7-5.8 climbing. Inspired by and reminiscent of Smokin' the Toad in Hackberry Creek. Good climbing on positive holds up the steep wall. **Full 35m, Please tie a knot in the end of the rope! Belay in the chimney under the first bolt*
content.protection: *70m ROPE REQUIRED** 14-15 Bolts, optional small/medium gear if you want to sew it up, Rap Ring Anchors on top.
content.location: Far right pillar on the Funny Farm. Start in the small chimney with 3 bolts taking you to the ledge above, then the real climbing starts.

climbs.name: Seats of Evil
climbs.fa: Clay Lippincott, Tyler Eglen, David Jacobs, Ryan Myers

content.description: A fantastic bit of face climbing up a well featured wall. Experience a variety of movement on this well protected route with the crux being at the top. Option to continue past the anchor onto a nice ledge with a separate anchor to link with pitch 2 of Pole Dancing Dragons, or bust out the trad rack and split off to the right to join pitch 2 of the Unknown Trad Route next door.
content.location: On the right side of the nice wall left of the Unknown Trad Route in the Dihedral. The bolted line to the left is Pole Dancing Dragons.

content.description: A bouldery start to a burly roof to an amazing slab is how you will remember Rocket Man. Pull hard through a BIG roof and then delicately climb your way to the anchors. A mega cool line that will push you harder than any of the other routes on the wall.
content.protection: 1 Bolt protects the start. 2 Perma-draws have been placed at the crux. (Please do not take the draws) 9 additional Protection Bolts up the slab to a 2 Bolt Rap Ring Anchor
content.location: To the left of Pole Dancing Dragons

climbs.name: Pole Dancing Dragons
climbs.fa: Clay Lippincott, David Jacobs, Ryan Myers, Tyler Eglen

content.description:
A truly enjoyable route to the top of the Funny Farm. This route consists of two pitches or can be set up as a single pitch for top-roping (USE YOUR OWN ANCHOR, DO NOT TOP-ROPE OFF THE RAP RINGS!) . If being done as a two pitch climb, best to clip the anchor as protection and continue 5ft higher to a nice ledge and separate anchor. 

 Pitch one climbs the nice featured face up and to the left and continues up the arete which provides awesome positioning and fun climbing. 

 Pitch 2 works up some easy steps off the ledge to a short steep section, from there follow the bolts up the sloping ramp to the crux. Once past the crux follow the bolts leftwards to the top. 

 Please be aware the second pitch could use some traffic to help clean it up a bit. Be sure your belayer and other climbers at the base have helmets on. A thorough cleaning has been done so it's mostly small flakes and things but still be AWARE!
content.protection: Quickdraws, Rap Ring anchors, Additional anchor provided on nice ledge 5 feet above pitch 1 anchors.
content.location: Left Side of the nice bolted wall. Left of Seats of Evil. Right of the overhanging handcrack.

climbs.name: Little Lost Lion
climbs.fa: Ryan Myers, Clay Lippincott FA, FFA S. Duemler

content.description: Initially TR'd by Ryan Myers, then cleaned and led ground up by Scott D and Michael G. Good pro, cleaned up nicely with a variety of technics including jams, stemming, offwidth, crimps. A great addition to the area.
content.protection: Singles from fingertips through #4, nuts, couple of alpine draws. Above bulge the are horizontals for gear so no cams bigger than a 4 necessary.
content.location: Crack System just left of Rocket Man and Pole Dancing Dragons.

climbs.name: Jesus is Real
climbs.fa: Scott Duemler, Aaron Peterson, Michael Genovese

content.description: When all hope is lost and the world seems to be crumbling around you, it's nice to know that Jesus is Real! If you can't wrap your head around Jesus, you can at least wrap your hand over the jug below the 4th bolt; Either way you'll feel a lot better about living.
content.protection: 7 bolts to a two bolt anchor with chain and steel, locking carabiners - please don't steal them.
content.location: Just left of the steep dihedral of Little Lost Lion, which is just left of Rocket Man.

climbs.name: First Dance
climbs.fa: Stephen Baklund, Clay Lippincott, Tyler Eglen, David Jacobs, Ryan Myers

content.description: A stout lil' line up a steep wall. Climb up an easy boulder, clip the first bolt and fire through the crux boulder problem, clipping bolts on your left as you go. Once through the crux, manage your pump and push for the anchors. Enjoy.
content.protection: 7 protection bolts to a 2 bolt rap ring anchor
content.location: In between Seats of Evil and Spaceball

climbs.name: Especial
climbs.fa: Ryan Myers, David Jacobs, Clay Lippincott, Tyler Eglen

content.description: A moderate trad line with many protection options. Some good rock and some loose rock, be cautious, "especially" on the ledge 3/4 of the way up not to knock loose rock onto your belayer. More traffic and cleaning should help.
content.protection: Standard trad rack, dependent on abilities, some poor rock in sections, be aware, helmet advised for belayer! Currently no anchor for this route. Descent Options: scramble over to the top and use the Rap Rings on Serious Enthusiasm, walk off, or build and leave a natural anchor with webbing.
content.location: The large crack to the left of Serious Enthusiasm. Tops out on a large boulder wedged between the two walls.

content.description: Start the same as you would for Serious Enthusiam but hang a left when you reach the big ledge. Then follow the left trending bolt line to the anchors. This is not a hard route and is very well bolted for the grade.
content.location: On the wall to the left of Especial

content.description: The start to this route is tricky and the rock is softer than most of the rock in the area, so be mindful up to the roof (hint don't get tricked into the off width to the left). Pull the roof to the right and cruise the rest of the way to the anchors while enjoying the view.
content.protection: 12 or 13 bolts to rap anchors. It’s not a mixed route so no gear is needed.  (We might be adding a perma draw below the roof)
content.location: Not too hard to find because it’s the only route in the area with glue in’s at the start.

content.description: This addition to the Atlantis area is comprised of several moderate routes (5.7-5.10) with a few multi-pitch routes and possible link up opportunities with Poseidon's Throne. Beware this Crag is still under development and loose rock is prevalent. Please wear a helmet at all times, especially while hanging out at the base. Traffic will help to clean up the routes over time.
